headline.main: NAZI USE OF RADIO TOLD AT SPY TRIAL; Purchase of Portable Sending Set Described as Wheeler-Hill Case Is Opened

lead_paragraph: The government yesterday opened its case against Axel Wheeler-Hill, accused with three others of operating a radio-sending set for the purpose of transmitting information on the sailings of ships from New York to Great Britain, as the trial of Wheeler-Hill and fifteen others charged with espionage and failure to register as agents of a foreign government continued before Judge Mortimer W. Byers and a jury in the United States District Court in Brooklyn.
